document.heading: Personal Delivery Device Weight Limit Emergency Amendment Act of 2025
To amend, on an emergency basis, the Personal Delivery Device Act of 2018 to increase the weight limit for personal delivery devices.
document.text: BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Personal Delivery Device Weight Limit Emergency Amendment Act of 2025".

section.text: The Personal Delivery Device Act of 2018, effective July 17, 2018 (D.C. Law 22-137; D.C. Official Code § 50-110.01 et seq.), is amended as follows:

para.text: Section 4(b) (D.C. Official Code § 50-110.03(b)) is amended as follows:
Paragraph (4) is amended by striking the phrase "; and" and inserting a semicolon in its place.
Paragraph (5) is amended by striking the period and inserting the phrase "; and" in its place.
A new paragraph (6) is added to read as follows:
Not exceed 250 pounds in weight, excluding any property being carried by the PDD, or a higher weight limit established by the Department through rulemaking.

section.heading: Fiscal impact statement.
section.text: The Council adopts the fiscal impact statement of the Budget Director as the fiscal impact statement required by section 4a of the General Legislative Procedures Act of 1975, approved October 16, 2006 (120 Stat. 2038; D.C. Official Code § 1-301.47a).

section.heading: Effective date.
section.text: This act shall take effect following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council to override the veto) and shall remain in effect for no longer than 90 days, as provided for emergency acts of the Council of the District of Columbia in section 412(a) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 788; D.C. Official Code § 1-204.12(a)).
